sentences: Meie isa annab meile igal aastal suure kingituse.
context: The Estonian word 'annab' is the 3rd person singular present tense form of the verb 'andma', which means 'to give'. It translates to English as 'gives', 'provides', or 'hands over'. This is a commonly used verb in everyday Estonian communication when describing someone giving something to another person.
